(28557, 31707).description: A climate model that uses a collocated (A-grid) grid in physical space

(28557, 31707).name: IFS-FVM
(28557, 31707).label: model
(28557, 31707).description: A climate model that uses a collocated (A-grid) grid in physical space

(28557, 31707).name: GCRMs
(28557, 31707).label: model
(28557, 31707).description: Global Cloud-Resolving Models, a type of climate model that resolves cloud processes and other small-scale atmospheric phenomena

(28557, 31707).name: GCMs
(28557, 31707).label: model
(28557, 31707).description: Global Climate Models, a type of climate model that uses parameterizations for unresolved processes

(28557, 31707).name: orographic drag
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The force exerted by mountains or hills on the atmosphere, influencing the flow of air

(28557, 31707).name: orographic gravity-wave drag
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The force exerted by mountains or hills on the atmosphere, influencing the flow of air through gravity waves

(28557, 31707).name: gravity waves
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: Atmospheric waves that are driven by the movement of air over mountains or other obstacles

(28557, 31707).name: clouds
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: Atmospheric phenomena that play a crucial role in the Earth's climate system

(28557, 31707).name: convective transports
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The movement of air and heat within the atmosphere, driven by convection

(28557, 31707).name: microphysical degrees of freedom
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The details of the physical processes that occur within clouds and other atmospheric phenomena

(28557, 31707).name: Lev
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The number of vertical levels used in a climate model

(28557, 31707).name: Top
(28557, 31707).label: variable
(28557, 31707).description: The top of the model, representing the upper boundary of the atmosphere

(31204, 34217).name: GCRMs
(31204, 34217).label: model
(31204, 34217).description: Global Cloud Resolving Models, a type of climate model that resolves cloud processes explicitly, allowing for more accurate simulations of atmospheric phenomena

(31204, 34217).name: GCMs
(31204, 34217).label: model
(31204, 34217).description: Global Climate Models, a type of climate model that uses parameterizations to represent sub-grid scale processes, such as cloud formation and precipitation

(31204, 34217).name: mesoscale systems
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: Atmospheric phenomena that occur on scales of tens to hundreds of kilometers, such as thunderstorms and fronts

(31204, 34217).name: gravity waves
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: Waves that propagate through the atmosphere, often generated by the movement of air over mountains or other obstacles

(31204, 34217).name: turbulences
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: Chaotic and irregular motions of air in the atmosphere, which are embedded in GCRM simulations

(31204, 34217).name: cloud microphysics
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: The study of the physical processes that occur within clouds, such as the formation of cloud droplets and ice crystals

(31204, 34217).name: satellite observations
(31204, 34217).label: instrument
(31204, 34217).description: Measurements of the Earth's atmosphere and surface made by instruments on satellites in orbit around the planet

(31204, 34217).name: ESiWACE
(31204, 34217).label: provider
(31204, 34217).description: A European project that coordinates and supports the development of weather and climate modeling, funded by the European Union's Horizon 2020 program

(31204, 34217).name: German Climate Computing Center
(31204, 34217).label: provider
(31204, 34217).description: A research institution that provides computing resources and support for climate modeling, and coordinates ESiWACE

(31204, 34217).name: convective clouds
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: Clouds that form when warm air rises and cools, often producing precipitation

(31204, 34217).name: entrainment/detrainment
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: The process by which air is drawn into or expelled from convective clouds, which can affect the development and behavior of the clouds

(31204, 34217).name: boundary layer processes
(31204, 34217).label: variable
(31204, 34217).description: The processes that occur in the layer of air closest to the Earth's surface, such as friction and heat transfer

(31204, 34217).name: global LES models
(31204, 34217).label: model
(31204, 34217).description: Global Large Eddy Simulation models, a type of climate model that resolves the smallest scales of atmospheric motion, with a mesh size of O(100 m

(31204, 34217).name: ICON
(31204, 34217).label: model
(31204, 34217).description: A global atmospheric model that has been tested for large-eddy simulations over a wide area, such as the whole of Germany

(31204, 34217).name: Germany
(31204, 34217).label: location
(31204, 34217).description: A country in Europe, used as a test case for the ICON model

(33723, 36411).name: DYAMOND
(33723, 36411).label: project
(33723, 36411).description: A research project focused on the development and application of global atmospheric models, supported by ESiWACE and funded by the European Union's Horizon 2020 program

(33723, 36411).name: German Climate Computing Center
(33723, 36411).label: provider
(33723, 36411).description: A research institution that provides high-performance computing resources and supports climate modeling research, responsible for the DYAMOND data archiving

(33723, 36411).name: European Union
(33723, 36411).label: provider
(33723, 36411).description: A political and economic union of European countries that funds research and development projects, including those related to climate modeling and high-performance computing

(33723, 36411).name: Horizon 2020
(33723, 36411).label: project
(33723, 36411).description: A European Union research and innovation program that provides funding for projects in various fields, including climate modeling and high-performance computing

(33723, 36411).name: NICAM
(33723, 36411).label: model
(33723, 36411).description: A global cloud-resolving model that uses an icosahedral mesh structure and a conservative nonhydrostatic equation system to simulate atmospheric processes

(33723, 36411).name: ICON
(33723, 36411).label: model
(33723, 36411).description: A global atmospheric model that uses a triangular tiling of the sphere and allows for multi-level two-way nesting, suitable for a range of applications from idealized to realistic domain simulations

(33723, 36411).name: MPAS
(33723, 36411).label: model
(33723, 36411).description: A collaborative project for developing atmosphere, ocean, and other Earth system simulation components, with a global nonhydrostatic atmosphere solver at its core

(33723, 36411).name: NCAR
(33723, 36411).label: provider
(33723, 36411).description: The National Center for Atmospheric Research, a research institution that develops and applies atmospheric and related sciences to understand the behavior of the Earth's atmosphere and related systems

(33723, 36411).name: global atmospheric models
(33723, 36411).label: model
(33723, 36411).description: Computational representations of the Earth's atmosphere, used to simulate and predict weather and climate patterns

(33723, 36411).name: coupled climate model
(33723, 36411).label: model
(33723, 36411).description: A type of climate model that integrates multiple components, such as atmosphere, ocean, and land, to simulate the interactions and feedbacks within the Earth's climate system

(33723, 36411).name: regional climate
(33723, 36411).label: location
(33723, 36411).description: A geographic region with distinct climate characteristics, often studied using regional climate models to understand local climate variability and change

(33723, 36411).name: moist convection
(33723, 36411).label: variable
(33723, 36411).description: A process in the atmosphere where warm, moist air rises, leading to the formation of clouds and precipitation, important for understanding weather and climate patterns

(33723, 36411).name: atmosphere
(33723, 36411).label: location
(33723, 36411).description: The layer of gases surrounding the Earth, influencing weather and climate patterns

(33723, 36411).name: ocean
(33723, 36411).label: location
(33723, 36411).description: The vast body of saltwater that covers over 70% of the Earth's surface, playing a crucial role in the Earth's climate system

(35927, 38755).name: MPAS-A
(35927, 38755).label: model
(35927, 38755).description: A global nonhydrostatic atmosphere solver developed at the National Center for Atmospheric Research (NCAR), used for weather and climate modeling

(35927, 38755).name: NCAR
(35927, 38755).label: provider
(35927, 38755).description: The National Center for Atmospheric Research, an American research institution focused on atmospheric science and climate research

(35927, 38755).name: vorticity
(35927, 38755).label: variable
(35927, 38755).description: A measure of the rotation of air in the atmosphere, important in meteorology and climate studies

(35927, 38755).name: potential temperature
(35927, 38755).label: variable
(35927, 38755).description: A measure of the temperature of air in the atmosphere, adjusted for the effects of altitude and humidity

(35927, 38755).name: regional climate
(35927, 38755).label: location
(35927, 38755).description: A geographic area characterized by a specific climate, often studied in the context of climate change and regional climate modeling

(35927, 38755).name: moist convection
(35927, 38755).label: weather event
(35927, 38755).description: A type of atmospheric convection that involves the movement of moist air, often leading to precipitation and severe weather

(35927, 38755).name: severe thunderstorms
(35927, 38755).label: weather event
(35927, 38755).description: A type of intense thunderstorm characterized by strong winds, heavy precipitation, and potential for tornadoes

(35927, 38755).name: GEOS-5
(35927, 38755).label: model
(35927, 38755).description: A comprehensive earth system model developed for diverse applications in climate and weather, including data assimilation and numerical weather prediction

(35927, 38755).name: GEOS model
(35927, 38755).label: model
(35927, 38755).description: A comprehensive earth system model developed for diverse applications in climate and weather, including data assimilation and numerical weather prediction

(35927, 38755).name: NCEP's Global Forecast System
(35927, 38755).label: model
(35927, 38755).description: A numerical weather prediction model developed by the National Centers for Environmental Prediction, used for forecasting weather patterns and climate trends

(35927, 38755).name: FV3
(35927, 38755).label: model
(35927, 38755).description: A dynamical core used in the FV3 model, developed by the Geophysical Fluid Dynamics Laboratory (GFDL), for weather and climate modeling

(35927, 38755).name: GFDL
(35927, 38755).label: provider
(35927, 38755).description: The Geophysical Fluid Dynamics Laboratory, a research institution focused on the study of the Earth's climate system and the development of climate models

(38251, 40960).name: GEOS
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A global climate model that integrates physical, chemical, and biological processes to simulate Earth's climate system

(38251, 40960).name: GEOS-5
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A specific version of the GEOS model, using the FV3 dynamical core and designed for global climate simulations at various horizontal resolutions

(38251, 40960).name: Earth System Modeling Framework
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A software framework used to build, couple, and integrate various components of Earth system models

(38251, 40960).name: SAM
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A global cloud-resolving model, designed to simulate cloud processes and their impact on the climate system

(38251, 40960).name: IFS-ST
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A spectral-transform model used for operational weather prediction, employing spherical harmonics and a semi-implicit semi-Lagrangian time stepping scheme

(38251, 40960).name: IFS-FVM
(38251, 40960).label: model
(38251, 40960).description: A finite-volume model developed for weather prediction, solving the compressible equations in physical space and sharing physical parameterizations with IFS-ST

(38251, 40960).name: ECMWF
(38251, 40960).label: provider
(38251, 40960).description: The European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts, an organization providing weather forecasts and climate research

(38251, 40960).name: topography
(38251, 40960).label: variable
(38251, 40960).description: The shape and features of the Earth's surface, influencing climate and weather patterns

(38251, 40960).name: terrain
(38251, 40960).label: variable
(38251, 40960).description: The physical features of the Earth's surface, including landforms and elevation, affecting local climate conditions

(38251, 40960).name: spherical harmonics
(38251, 40960).label: instrument
(38251, 40960).description: A mathematical technique used to represent physical fields on a sphere, employed in climate models for efficient computation

(38251, 40960).name: Creative Commons license
(38251, 40960).label: platform
(38251, 40960).description: A public license that allows for the free use, distribution, and reproduction of creative works, under certain conditions

(40647, 40960).name: Creative Commons license
(40647, 40960).label: instrument
(40647, 40960).description: A public license that allows for the free use, sharing, and adaptation of creative works, with certain conditions
